org.daisy.streamline.api.tasks

Interface TaskSystemFactory


  • public interface TaskSystemFactory
    Provides an interface for task system factories. A task system factory implementation can provide task system instances for any number of specifications.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default int getPriority()
      Returns the priority when choosing between several matching task systems.
      java.util.Set<TaskSystemInformation> listForInput(FormatIdentifier input, java.lang.String locale)
      Gets a set with information about supported task systems for the specified input format and locale.
      java.util.Set<TaskSystemInformation> listForOutput(FormatIdentifier output, java.lang.String locale)
      Gets a set with information about supported task systems for the specified output format and locale.
      java.util.Set<FormatIdentifier> listInputs()
      Lists available input formats.
      java.util.Set<FormatIdentifier> listOutputs()
      Lists available output formats.
      TaskSystem newTaskSystem(java.lang.String inputFormat, java.lang.String outputFormat, java.lang.String locale)
      Creates a new task system with the given properties.
      default void setCreatedWithSPI()
      Informs the implementation that it was discovered and instantiated using information collected from a file within the META-INF/services directory.
      boolean supportsSpecification(java.lang.String inputFormat, java.lang.String outputFormat, java.lang.String locale)
      Returns true if this factory can create instances with the desired properties.

    • Method Detail

      • supportsSpecification

        boolean supportsSpecification(java.lang.String inputFormat,
                              java.lang.String outputFormat,
                              java.lang.String locale)
        Returns true if this factory can create instances with the desired properties.
        Parameters:
        inputFormat - the desired input format
        outputFormat - the desired output format
        locale - the desired locale
        Returns:
        returns true if this factory can create instances with the desired properties, false otherwise

      • newTaskSystem

        TaskSystem newTaskSystem(java.lang.String inputFormat,
                         java.lang.String outputFormat,
                         java.lang.String locale)
                  throws TaskSystemFactoryException
        Creates a new task system with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        inputFormat - the desired input format
        outputFormat - the desired output format
        locale - the desired locale
        Returns:
        returns a new task system
        Throws:
        TaskSystemFactoryException - if a task system with these properties cannot be created

      • getPriority

        default int getPriority()
        Returns the priority when choosing between several matching task systems.
        Returns:

      • setCreatedWithSPI

        default void setCreatedWithSPI()

        Informs the implementation that it was discovered and instantiated using information collected from a file within the META-INF/services directory. In other words, it was created using SPI (service provider interfaces).

        This information, in turn, enables the implementation to use the same mechanism to set dependencies as needed.

        If this information is not given, an implementation should avoid using SPIs and instead use declarative services for dependency injection as specified by OSGi. Note that this also applies to several newInstance() methods in the Java API.

        The class that created an instance with SPI must call this method before putting it to use.
